remarks.format:
## Remarks The display mode is available through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ViewMode%2A> property. This enumeration allows the user to set the current display mode of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> control. If you have an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> with an item template, you can place a button in each item, handle the click event on the button, and set the view mode to the `Details` view to show the item details.
> [!NOTE] > You must first select an item before setting this enumeration to `Commands` or `Details` view. An attempt to set the enumeration before selecting an item throws an exception.

Docs.summary: Command's view in WML. This is the default view displayed when the page containing the object list is rendered for the first time. It consists of either the label fields of the items, or (when TableFields is not empty) a table with columns corresponding to the table fields and rows corresponding to items.
